channel.title: How To Do A System Update
channel.description:
I have no idea how to do System Update, like the yellow writing near the PM's?
I tried ::update 10
Maybe it's not coded?
Any help thanks.

item.title: How To Do A System Update
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

Everyone is amusing you have the packet but that might not be the case:

System Update: 114
Type: Fixed
Length: 2

LEShort - Delay

See: http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317:System_update

Read full topic
item.source: How To Do A System Update

item.title: How To Do A System Update
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Cyc. You can replace the name on one of those commands with your username, and remove the other.
Then in game you’d do: ::update int
int being a number

Read full topic
item.source: How To Do A System Update

item.title: How To Do A System Update
item.dc:creator: @Cycnyg Cycnyg
item.description:
@Cycnyg wrote:

I found this …

{

		if (playerCommand.startsWith("update") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("owner alex)) {
			String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
			int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
			PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a;
			PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
			PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
			PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
		}

		if (playerCommand.startsWith("update") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("owner tavar")) {
			String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
			int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
			PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a;
			PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
			PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
			PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
		}

Does this have to do with anything? Do I edit or delete it and paste the new one?

Read full topic
item.source: How To Do A System Update

item.title: How To Do A System Update
item.dc:creator: @beats beats
item.description:
@beats wrote:

[quote=“Cycnyg, post:6, topic:522811”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=641304.msg4320547#msg4320547 date=1372169417]
That has nothing to do with updating the game.
[/quote]

Well then obviously I don’t have it… LOL

And my revision is 317/614[/quote]

614: if (command[0].equalsIgnoreCase("update")){ if (Integer.parseInt(command[1]) > 0){ for(Player p: World.getWorld().getPlayers()){ ActionSender.sendSystemUpdate(p, Integer.parseInt(command[1])); } } }

Read full topic
item.source: How To Do A System Update

Cycnyg:

Hey thanks…! Do you know where to paste it ?

Yeah. Your commands file.

item.title: How To Do A System Update
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

		if (playerCommand.startsWith("update")) {
			PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = 120;
			PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
			PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
			PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
		}

This does a 2 minute update I believe.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Do A System Update
item.dc:creator: @Cycnyg Cycnyg
item.description:
@Cycnyg wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“xxxhp”) && (c.playerRights >= 3)) {
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
c.playerLevel[3] = 99999;
c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
c.gfx0(1555);
c.sendMessage(“You have inf hp cause Love has demanded it.”);

Read full topic
